data.title: Katy Perry's Azorean Roots
data.text:
Hi Katherine,

Enjoyed your post about Katy Perry. Having the Perry name in my

ancestry I have been very curious about her Portuguese roots and was

trying to find out more about her Faial ggrandfather's surnames and

families. If anyone has more information please let me know. Thanks....

Pat

î—“

>--

>To unsubscribe from this group, send email to

>Azores+un...@googlegroups.com. Follow the confirmation

>directions when they arrive.

>For more options, such as changing to List, Digest, Abridged, or No

>Mail (vacation) mode, log into your Google account and visit this

>group at http://groups.google.com/group/Azores. Click in the blue

>area on the right that says "Join this group" and it will take you

>to "Edit my membership."

At 12:14 PM 5/1/2011, you wrote:

>Hi Elaine,

>My mom's maiden name was Perry. (Pereira) and my mother in law was

>also a Perry, possibly English origin. Alvina Gussie Perry born in

>California,June of 1896. Haven't tackled that Perry line yet.

>

>Pat

My maternal great-grandmother's maiden name was Perry. She and my

ggrandfather emigrated from Faial (not sure of the village). At

least in my grandfather's family, the first son was named for his

father and given his mother's name as a middle name (in the records

over here). It looks like all my mother's ancestors were originally

from Faial, with my maternal grandmother's people from Flamingos. My

grandfather was Augustus Perry Monteiro--his father was Augustus

Garcia Monteiro and his mother was Olivia Perry.

Joan Mary Jurancich

Sacramento, CA

Researching Monteiro, Perry, Fialho, Gonsalves (Goncalves), Garcia,

da Silva, da Rosa on Faial
